publications.title: Electronic relaxation rate calculations and spectral density analysis
publications.abstract: We show that the computations of relaxation rate is solution are highly sensitive to the choice of representation of the environmental spectral density (SD). The key reason is that electronic relaxation is dominated by the resonant contribution from the high-frequency tails of the SD, which can vary significantly between strategies.

publications.title: Quantum dynamics and simulation methods
publications.abstract: Advanced quantum dynamics simulation using semiclassical methods.

publications.title: Semiclassical methods for large quantum systems
publications.abstract: Development of efficient semiclassical approaches for studying large quantum systems.

publications.title: Computational chemistry applications
publications.abstract: Applications of computational methods to chemical systems.
